reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: I have a houseful of these dimmers and the on off toggle fails frequently due to bad engineering. (These are labeled "Assembled in Mexico.) Replacements (now labeled "Made in China") are problematic for different reasons: The mounting screws are shorter than customary making installation a problem, the wiring convention has been changed making a direct replacement a nuisance, and the instructions are impossible to read. All-in-all, poor design which is not user friendly. I have fired engineers for less than these design faults.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2018
reviews.title: Stay Away From This Brand.

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: At first I was very happy with this dimmer: looks nice, comes with a choice of color, and is very smooth to use. But after 2 years it started malfunctioning: I had to press the on-off button several times to make it work.And then it stopped working completely so I couldn't turn the lights off at all! My son who works in home renovation also noticed how hot it gets and warned me that it could become a serious fire hazard! Yet it is controlling 9x60w bulbs only (540w). I am disappointed and am now looking for a different one.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2016
reviews.title: Disappointing!

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: I installed this to switch 900 watts of halogen track lights, and it worked fine until the switch wore out after two years. I have had the same problem with other brands. It seems that the switch can't handle the high inrush current from halogen lamps. I would only try to use this up to maybe 500 watts of halogen fixtures. My solution, since I had the space in the switch box, was to buy a new unit (different brand) and use a separate switch to switch the power to this unit.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2014
reviews.title: Can't handle high-wattage halogen lamps

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: We have several areas around the house that have more bulbs on a dimmer than the usual 600W will handle. You can pay a lot more at Home Depot or elsewhere to get 900W or 1200W, but this unit works great! I researched carefully and found that removing one side of the tabs de-rates from 1000W to 800W, and we have a circuit with 10 60W bulbs (10x60=600W). Working through the entire range from dim to bright, this unit never gets too hot - and we run the lights all night for back-yard security. I would have rated 5 stars but it is challenging big; takes some effort to get all the wires into a standard box. But then... that's why it can handle the heat! Go for it!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2012
reviews.title: Solid Product!

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: Purchased for our church in updating the electrical circuits. Simple installation and different color face plates make it a very versatile switch. Would recommend to anyone needing or wanting a dimmer switch.

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: I felt compelled to write this review on the basis of long-term satisfaction. First of all, we love these dimmers. They have a subtle green led that makes an attractive but muted glow, are easy to hit as an on/off button, and a very accessible and easily adjusted dimmer. We have every light in our house on dimmers, and they are a delight to use, look great, and are easy enough to use that you'll find yourself adjusting the amount of light nearly every time you use them. Why only 2 stars for something we like so much? Quality and durability. They break, repeatedly and often. We have over 80 of these dimmers in our home, with an average age of 5 years. We replace about 5-6 dimmers every year. The most common problem is when the push button switch stops catching-- I'm writing this to light of 3 chandeliers I can't turn off-- the switch won't work. They also crack. They are dimmers, and with moving parts, they are not expected to last as long as a simple rocker switch. But a 8-10% annual failure rate is simply too high. Some of the first ones we installed have been working now for 10 years without trouble. The newer ones we installed on our addition have had more problems. The one not working in my office was just replaced 4 months ago and is now broken. Great product, poor quality and durability. I'm certain Leviton knows this, and we have too many of them for this to be a random streak of bad luck, or a single bad batch. Great engineering can't trump poor quality control.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2012
reviews.title: Why only 2 stars?

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: Not sure what the negative comments are about - I have five of these dimmers installed in my house and love them. The oldest is almost 8yrs old and no problems with any of them to date. The green light makes the switches easy to find in the dark and the large on/off button is easy to hit. What more could you ask for?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2012
reviews.title: Love these dimmers

reviews.productTitle: Leviton IllumaTech Dimmer Switch for Incandescent Bulbs, IPI10-1LZ, White
reviews.text: These are the worst switches I have ever purchased. I cannot say enough bad about them. They cannot handle 1000w at all. I have purchased probably ten of these in the last two years. I have had 4 or 5 of them go bad on me now. I'm sure that all of them will go bad before too long. Do not buy these. You are wasting your money.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2012
reviews.title: HORRIBLE QUALITY
